block.p: In your enumeration of many of the current Washington scandals, and the concomitant presence of Karl Rove's ''tracks'' everywhere (''The Rovian Era,'' editorial, April 1), the most significant scandal was unmentioned: the Iraq war.

In your enumeration of many of the current Washington scandals, and the concomitant presence of Karl Rove's ''tracks'' everywhere (''The Rovian Era,'' editorial, April 1), the most significant scandal was unmentioned: the Iraq war.

Many of us believe that the primary reason for the invasion was to facilitate the accumulation of overwhelming political capital and post-Desert-Storm-like favorability ratings, from the achievement of an easy and decisive military victory over a widely perceived embodiment of evil associated (falsely) with 9/11.
The aim was to manipulate post-9/11 anger and to then use postwar euphoria as a means to guarantee the implementation of the Bush administration's economic, social and political agenda.
Surely Mr. Rove's tracks are similarly omnipresent near the dice that were rolled toward that end.
Alan J. Ross Newton, Mass., April 1, 2007
